setDefaultFilterOperator.!description: Sets a new value for property defaultFilterOperator. If this property is set the default filter operator of the column is overwritten. By default "Contains" is used for string and "EQ" for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

toggleSort.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.1 Please use the function "sap.ui.Table.prototype.sort".
toggles the sort order of the column

getFilterType.!description: Gets current value of property filterType. Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the classname of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.

getFlexible.!description: Gets current value of property flexible. Is the width of the column flexible (grows on resize)? Default value is true.

setFilterType.!description: Sets a new value for property filterType. Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the classname of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

You have to set the text align directly on the template. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Begin.

When moving columns all columns which are part of the header will be moved. This can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a seperate span for each header row. Default value is 1.

If not set as fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getHAlign.!description: Gets current value of property hAlign. Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template. Default value is Begin.

setHeaderSpan.!description: Sets a new value for property headerSpan. If this property is set a span is applied for the header. If you only specify an integer this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a seperate span for each header row. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding. Default value is 0.

sap.ui.table.DataTable.!description:
Provides a comprehensive set of features for displaying and dealing with vast amounts of data. The Table control supports desktop PCs and tablet devices. On tablets, special consideration should be given to the number of visible columns and rows due to the limited performance of some devices.

In order to keep the document DOM as lean as possible, the Table control reuses its DOM elements of the rows. When the user scrolls, only the row contexts are changed but the rendered controls remain the same. This allows the Table control to handle huge amounts of data. Nevertheless, restrictions apply regarding the number of displayed columns. Keep the number as low as possible to improve performance. Due to the nature of tables, the used control for column templates also has a big influence on the performance.

The Table control relies completely on data binding, and its supported feature set is tightly coupled to the data model and binding being used.

expandToLevel.!description:
Collapses all nodes on level 'iLevel' (and lower if collapseRecursive is activated)
If no parameter is given, all nodes will be collapsed to the topmost level.

Only supported with ODataModel v2.

fireRowSelectionChange.!description:
Fires event rowSelectionChange to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'rowIndex' of type introw index which has been clicked so that the selection has been changed (either selected or deselected)
  • 'rowContext' of type objectbinding context of the row which has been clicked so that selection has been changed
  • 'rowIndices' of type int[]array of row indices which selection has been changed (either selected or deselected)

getEnableBusyIndicator.!description: Gets current value of property enableBusyIndicator. Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own. The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling. Default value is false.

setExpanded.!description: Sets a new value for property expanded. Flag whether the Table is expanded or not When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

setSelectedIndex.!description: Sets a new value for property selectedIndex. Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is -1.

setRowHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property rowHeight. Height of a row of the Table in pixel. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

addSelectionInterval.!description: Adds the given selection interval to the selection. In case of single selection the "indexTo" value will be used for as selected index.

detachColumnResize.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnResize' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

detachCellContextmenu.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'cellContextmenu' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.table.DataTable.

detachFilter.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'filter' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

attachColumnFreeze.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnFreeze' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when a column of the table should be freezed
attachColumnFreeze.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

attachRowSelectionChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'rowSelectionChange' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when the row selection of the table has been changed (the event parameters can be used to determine selection changes - to find out the selected rows you should better use the table selection API)
attachRowSelectionChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

removeExtension.!description: Removes a extension from the aggregation named extension.

getHierarchical.!description: Gets current value of property hierarchical. Flag, whether the table displays its content hierarchical or not (**experimental**!!) Default value is false.

setExpandedVisibleRowCount.!description: Sets a new value for property expandedVisibleRowCount. Count of visible rows when expanded When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

setFixedRowCount.!description: Setter for property fixedRowCount. This property is not supportd for the TreeTable and will be ignored! Default value is 0

removeColumn.!description: Removes a column from the aggregation named columns.

getSelectionBehavior.!description: Gets current value of property selectionBehavior. Selection behavior of the Table. This property defines whether the row selector is displayed and whether the row, the row selector or both can be clicked to select a row. Default value is RowSelector.

attachCellClick.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'cellClick' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when the user clicks a cell of the table (experimental!).
attachCellClick.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

getContextByIndex.!description:
Returns the context of a row by its index. Please note that for server based models like OData
the supplied index might not have been loaded yet. If the context is not available at the client
the binding will trigger a backend request and request this single context. Although this API
looks synchronous it may not return a context but load it and fire a change event on the binding.

setVisibleRowCountMode.!description: Sets a new value for property visibleRowCountMode. This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is, that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change the visibleRowCount interactively. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Fixed.

expand.!description: expands the row for the given row index

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property width. Width of the Table. Default value is auto.

setEnableColumnFreeze.!description: Sets a new value for property enableColumnFreeze. Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

attachColumnVisibility.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnVisibility' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when the visibility of a table column is changed.
attachColumnVisibility.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

collapse.!description: collapses the row for the given row index

getEnableColumnReordering.!description: Gets current value of property enableColumnReordering. Flag to enable or disable column reordering Default value is true.

getEditable.!description: Gets current value of property editable. Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color in certain themes!) Default value is true.

attachColumnMove.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnMove' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when a table column is moved.
attachColumnMove.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

getNoDataText.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
Gets current value of property noDataText. This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.

attachRowSelect.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'rowSelect' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when the row selection of the table has been changed
attachRowSelect.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

detachColumnSelect.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnSelect' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

fireToggleOpenState.!description:
Fires event toggleOpenState to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'rowIndex' of type intindex of the expanded/collapsed row
  • 'rowContext' of type objectbinding context of the selected row
  • 'expanded' of type booleanflag whether the node has been expanded or collapsed

attachCustomFilter.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'customFilter' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. This event is triggered when the custom filter item of the column menu is pressed. The column on which the event was triggered is passed as parameter.
attachCustomFilter.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

setShowOverlay.!description: Sets a new value for property showOverlay. Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

getToolbar.!description: Gets content of aggregation toolbar. Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

detachColumnMove.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnMove' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

fireCellContextmenu.!description:
Fires event cellContextmenu to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'cellControl' of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe control of the cell.
  • 'rowIndex' of type intRow index of the selected cell.
  • 'columnIndex' of type intColumn index of the selected cell.

indexOfColumn.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.table.Column in the aggregation named columns. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

destroyTitle.!description: Destroys the title in the aggregation named title.

fireColumnMove.!description:
Fires event columnMove to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnmoved column.
  • 'newPos' of type intnew position of the column.

setFixedBottomRowCount.!description: Sets a new value for property fixedBottomRowCount. Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

isIndexSelected.!description: Returns whether the given index is selected.

getExpandFirstLevel.!description: Gets current value of property expandFirstLevel. Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level. Default value is false.

setColumnHeaderHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property columnHeaderHeight. Height of the column header of the Table in pixel. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getFixedColumnCount.!description: Gets current value of property fixedColumnCount. Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work. Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there will be no scrollbar for fixed columns. Default value is 0.

filter.!description: filter the given column by the given value
filter.!type:
function filter() { [native code for Array.filter, arity=1] }
, oColumn: sap.ui.table.Column, sValue: String) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

getExpanded.!description: Gets current value of property expanded. Flag whether the Table is expanded or not Default value is false.

fireSort.!description:
Fires event sort to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnsorted column.
  • 'sortOrder' of type sap.ui.table.SortOrderSort Order
  • 'columnAdded' of type booleanIf column was added to sorter this is true. If new sort is started this is set to false

detachGroup.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'group' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

setShowNoData.!description: Sets a new value for property showNoData. Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty. If set to false the table will just show a grid of empty cells When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

fireRowSelect.!description:
Fires event rowSelect to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'rowIndex' of type introw index which row has been selected or deselected
  • 'rowContext' of type objectbinding context of the row index which row has been selected or deselected
  • 'rowIndices' of type int[]array of row indices which selection has been changed (either selected or deselected)

setExpandFirstLevel.!description: Sets a new value for property expandFirstLevel. Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

getSelectionMode.!description: Gets current value of property selectionMode. Selection mode of the Table. This property controls whether single or multiple rows can be selected and how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance. Default value is Multi.

detachCellClick.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'cellClick' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

destroyFooter.!description: Destroys the footer in the aggregation named footer.

setNavigationMode.!description: Sets a new value for property navigationMode. Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library! When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Scrollbar.

indexOfExtension.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation named extension. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

attachGroup.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'group' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when the table is grouped (experimental!).
attachGroup.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

getRows.!description: Gets content of aggregation rows. Rows of the Table

setSelectionBehavior.!description: Sets a new value for property selectionBehavior. Selection behavior of the Table. This property defines whether the row selector is displayed and whether the row, the row selector or both can be clicked to select a row. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is RowSelector.

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property width. Width of the Table. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is auto.

isExpanded.!description: Returns whether the row is expanded or collapsed.

destroyNoData.!description: Destroys the noData in the aggregation named noData.

removeSelectionInterval.!description: Removes the given selection interval from the selection. In case of single selection this call removeSelectedIndex with the "indexTo" value.

fireCellClick.!description:
Fires event cellClick to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'cellControl' of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe control of the cell.
  • 'rowIndex' of type intRow index of the selected cell.
  • 'columnIndex' of type intColumn index of the selected cell.

getRowHeight.!description: Gets current value of property rowHeight. Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

getFixedRowCount.!description: Gets current value of property fixedRowCount. Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. Default value is 0.

getGroupHeaderProperty.!description: Gets current value of property groupHeaderProperty. The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled

getEnableCellFilter.!description: Gets current value of property enableCellFilter. Flag whether to enable or disable the context menu on cells to trigger a filtering with the cell value. Default value is false.

destroyRows.!description: Destroys all the rows in the aggregation named rows.

getGroupBy.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the groupBy association, or null. Group By Column (experimental!)

setNoDataText.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
Sets a new value for property noDataText. This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getExpandedVisibleRowCount.!description: Gets current value of property expandedVisibleRowCount. Count of visible rows when expanded

detachColumnFreeze.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnFreeze' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

getAllowColumnReordering.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Gets current value of property allowColumnReordering. Flag to enable or disable column reordering Default value is true.

getEnableSelectAll.!description: Gets current value of property enableSelectAll. Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner. This button is only displayed if the row selector is visible and the selection mode is set to any kind of multi selection. Default value is true.

fireColumnVisibility.!description:
Fires event columnVisibility to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnaffected column.
  • 'visible' of type booleannew value of the visible property.

selectAll.!description:
Add all rows to the selection.
Please note that for server based models like OData the indices which are considered to be selected might not
be available at the client yet. Calling getContextByIndex might not return a result but trigger a roundtrip
to request this single entity.

indexOfRow.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.table.Row in the aggregation named rows. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

fireColumnFreeze.!description:
Fires event columnFreeze to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnreference to the column to freeze

getColumnHeaderHeight.!description: Gets current value of property columnHeaderHeight. Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.

attachColumnResize.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnResize' event of this sap.ui.table.DataTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.DataTable itself. fired when a table column is resized.
attachColumnResize.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.DataTable

setMinAutoRowCount.!description: Sets a new value for property minAutoRowCount. This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto. For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 5.

insertExtension.!description: Inserts a extension into the aggregation named extension.

setEnableCustomFilter.!description: Sets a new value for property enableCustomFilter. Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

bindColumns.!description: Binds aggregation columns to model data. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#bindAggregation ManagedObject.bindAggregation} for a detailed description of the possible properties of oBindingInfo.

getFirstVisibleRow.!description: Gets current value of property firstVisibleRow. First visible row. Default value is 0.

setUseGroupMode.!description: Sets a new value for property useGroupMode. If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers. This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table. This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

getNumberOfExpandedLevels.!description: Gets current value of property numberOfExpandedLevels. Number of levels, which should be opened initially (on first load of data). Default value is 0.

setSelectionInterval.!description:
Sets the selection of the TreeTable to the given range (including boundaries).
Beware: The previous selection will be lost/overriden. If this is not wanted, please use "addSelectionInterval" and
"removeSelectionIntervall".

setDirty.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.2 Please use setShowOverlay instead.
Sets a new value for property dirty. If dirty the content of the Table will be overlayed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getDirty.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.2 Please use setShowOverlay instead.
Gets current value of property dirty. If dirty the content of the Table will be overlayed.

getCollapseRecursive.!description: Gets current value of property collapseRecursive. Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed. Default value is true.

getTotalSize.!description: Returns the total size of the data entries.

setSelectionMode.!description:
Sets the selection mode, the current selection is lost.
Since the AnalyticalTable relies on the RowSelector for rendering the group headers the SelectionMode "None" is
not supported and must not be used.

collapseAll.!description: Collapses all nodes (and lower if collapseRecursive is activated)

getContextByIndex.!description: Returns the context of a row by its index.

setSelectionBehavior.!description:
Sets the selection behavior.
Since the AnalyticalTable relies on the RowSelector for rendering the group headers the SelectionBehavior "RowOnly" is
not supported and must not be used.

setNumberOfExpandedLevels.!description: Sets a new value for property numberOfExpandedLevels. Number of levels, which should be opened initially (on first load of data). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

removeSelectionInterval.!description:
All rows/tree nodes inside the range (including boundaries) will be deselected.
Tree nodes are referenced with theit absolute row index inside the tree- 
Please be aware, that the absolute row index only applies to the the tree which is visualized by the TreeTable.
Invisible nodes (collapsed child nodes) will not be regarded.

setColumnVisibilityMenuSorter.!description: Sets a new value for property columnVisibilityMenuSorter. Functions which is used to sort the column visibility menu entries e.g.: function(ColumnA, ColumnB) { return 0 = equals, <0 lower, >0 greater }; Other values than functions will be ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getColumnVisibilityMenuSorter.!description: Gets current value of property columnVisibilityMenuSorter. Functions which is used to sort the column visibility menu entries e.g.: function(ColumnA, ColumnB) { return 0 = equals, <0 lower, >0 greater }; Other values than functions will be ignored.

clearSelection.!description: Clears the complete selection (all tree table rows/nodes will lose their selection)

getSelectedIndices.!description:
Returns an array containing the row indices of all selected tree nodes (ordered ascending).

Please be aware of the following:
Due to performance/network traffic reasons, the getSelectedIndices function returns only all indices
of actually selected rows/tree nodes. Unknown rows/nodes (as in "not yet loaded" to the client), will not be
returned.

getSumOnTop.!description: Gets current value of property sumOnTop. Specifies if the total values should be displayed in the group headers or on bottom of the row. Does not affact the total sum. Default value is false.

selectAll.!description:
Selects all available nodes/rows.

Explanation of the SelectAll function and what to expect from its behavior:
All rows/tree nodes locally stored on the client are selected.
In addition all subsequent rows/tree nodes, which will be paged into view are also immediatly selected.
However, due to obvious performance/network traffic reasons, the SelectAll function will NOT retrieve any data from the backend.

setSumOnTop.!description: Sets a new value for property sumOnTop. Specifies if the total values should be displayed in the group headers or on bottom of the row. Does not affact the total sum. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable.!description:
Table which handles analytical OData backends. The AnalyticalTable only works with an AnalyticalBinding and
correctly annotated OData services. Please check on the SAP Annotations for OData Version 2.0 documentation for further details.

getAutoExpandMode.!description: Gets current value of property autoExpandMode. The kind of auto expansion algorithm, e.g. optimised filter conditions, per level requests, ... sap.ui.table.TreeAutoExpandMode Default value is Bundled.

isIndexSelected.!description: Checks if the row at the given index is selected.

setSelectedIndex.!description:
Overriden from Table.js base class.
In a TreeTable you can only select indices, which correspond to the currently visualized tree.
Invisible tree nodes (e.g. collapsed child nodes) can not be selected via Index, because they do not
correspond to a TreeTable row.

addSelectionInterval.!description:
Marks a range of tree nodes as selected, starting with iFromIndex going to iToIndex.
The TreeNodes are referenced via their absolute row index.
Please be aware, that the absolute row index only applies to the the tree which is visualized by the TreeTable.
Invisible nodes (collapsed child nodes) will not be regarded.

Please also take notice of the fact, that "addSelectionInterval" does not change any other selection.
To override the current selection, please use "setSelctionInterval" or for a single entry use "setSelectedIndex".

getSelectedIndex.!description:
Retrieves the lead selection index. The lead selection index is, among other things, used to determine the
start/end of a selection range, when using Shift-Click to select multiple entries at once.

setAutoExpandMode.!description: Sets a new value for property autoExpandMode. The kind of auto expansion algorithm, e.g. optimised filter conditions, per level requests, ... sap.ui.table.TreeAutoExpandMode When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Bundled.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable.

visibleRowCountMode.!description:
This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is,
that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is
changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is
allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of
the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change
the visibleRowCount interactively.

expandFirstLevel.!description: Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level.

autoExpandMode.!description:
The kind of auto expansion algorithm, e.g. optimised filter conditions, per level requests, ...
sap.ui.table.TreeAutoExpandMode

sumOnTop.!description: Specifies if the total values should be displayed in the group headers or on bottom of the row. Does not affact the total sum.

selectionBehavior.!description:
Selection behavior of the Table. This property defines whether the row selector is displayed and whether the row, the row selector or both
can be clicked to select a row.

filtered.!description: flag, if the column is filtered or not (displays the filter indicator, does not trigger the filter method!)

enableBusyIndicator.!description:
Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own.
The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only
be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control

showOverlay.!description: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.

enableSelectAll.!description:
Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner. This button is only displayed
if the row selector is visible and the selection mode is set to any kind of multi selection.

columnHeaderVisible.!description: Flag whether the column header is visible or not.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

groupHeaderFormatter.!description: If the column is grouped, this formatter is used to format the value in the group header

enableCellFilter.!description: Flag whether to enable or disable the context menu on cells to trigger a filtering with the cell value.

hierarchical.!description: Flag, whether the table displays its content hierarchical or not (**experimental**!!)

selectionMode.!description:
Selection mode of the Table. This property controls whether single or multiple rows can be selected and
how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance.

grouped.!description: flag, if the column is grouped or not (hides the column!)

showIfGrouped.!description: Specifies whether the column is displayed within the table even if it is grouped or not. A grouped column has the same value for every rows within the group.

columnHeaderHeight.!description: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.

resizable.!description: Is the column resizable or not?

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

noDataText.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.

inResult.!description: Specifies that the dimension referred to by the column shall be included in the granularity of the data result. It allows a finer distinction between a visible/grouped/(included)inResult column.

minAutoRowCount.!description:
This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto or Interactive.
For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.

visibleRowCount.!description: Number of visible rows of the table.

allowColumnReordering.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Flag to enable or disable column reordering

navigationMode.!description: Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library!

expanded.!description: Flag whether the Table is expanded or not

flexible.!description: Is the width of the column flexible (grows on resize)?

rowHeight.!description: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

editable.!description: Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color in certain themes!)

enableColumnReordering.!description: Flag to enable or disable column reordering

expandedVisibleRowCount.!description: Count of visible rows when expanded

rootLevel.!description:
The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services.
This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding.

showSortMenuEntry.!description: Define if the sort menu entries are displayed

fixedColumnCount.!description:
Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only
the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there
will be no scrollbar for fixed columns.

filterType.!description: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the classname of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.

filterProperty.!description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will filter.

customDataKey.!description: By defining a custom data key the TablePersoController will try to get the key for saving the perso data from the custom data of the Table and Column instead of creating it by concatenating the ID of the Table and the Column. Basically this will be more stable than using the auto IDs.

enableGrouping.!description: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)

persoService.!description:
Personalization Service object. Needs to have the following methods:
  • getPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • setPersData(oBundle) : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • delPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)

groupHeaderProperty.!description: The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled

columnVisibilityMenuSorter.!description: Functions which is used to sort the column visibility menu entries e.g.: function(ColumnA, ColumnB) { return 0 = equals, <0 lower, >0 greater }; Other values than functions will be ignored.

hAlign.!description: Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.

showFilterMenuEntry.!description: Define if the filter menu entry is displayed

filterValue.!description: Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the propert data type).

filterOperator.!description: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.

name.!description: The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text. If not set as fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.

dirty.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.2 Please use setShowOverlay instead.
If dirty the content of the Table will be overlayed.

enableColumnFreeze.!description: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.

headerSpan.!description: If this property is set a span is applied for the header. When moving columns all columns which are part of the header will be moved. This can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a seperate span for each header row.

selectedIndex.!description:
Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1.
When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns
the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method
removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.

autoResizable.!description: Enables auto-resizing of the column on doubleclicking the resizer. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link , sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox

sortProperty.!description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort.

defaultFilterOperator.!description:
If this property is set the default filter operator of the column is overwritten.
By default "Contains" is used for string and "EQ" for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.

sorted.!description: flag, if the column is sorted or not (displays the sorting indicator, does not trigger the sort method!)

showNoData.!description:
Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty. If set to false
the table will just show a grid of empty cells

collapseRecursive.!description:
Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel

fixedBottomRowCount.!description: Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

showColumnVisibilityMenu.!description:
Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu. This menu will get displayed in each
generated column header menu. It allows to show or hide columns

threshold.!description: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.

sap.ui.table.!description: Table-like controls, mainly for desktop scenarios.

numberOfExpandedLevels.!description: Number of levels, which should be opened initially (on first load of data).

summed.!description: If defined a sum for this column is calculated

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.

enableCustomFilter.!description:
Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button
will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.

useGroupMode.!description:
If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers.
This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table.
This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries)

fixedRowCount.!description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

leadingProperty.!description: Defines the primary model property which is used inside the Column. In case of the analytical extension this means the property which is grouped by for dimensions or the property which is summed for measures.

setSummed.!description: Sets a new value for property summed. If defined a sum for this column is calculated When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

setLeadingProperty.!description: Sets a new value for property leadingProperty. Defines the primary model property which is used inside the Column. In case of the analytical extension this means the property which is grouped by for dimensions or the property which is summed for measures. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getShowIfGrouped.!description: Gets current value of property showIfGrouped. Specifies whether the column is displayed within the table even if it is grouped or not. A grouped column has the same value for every rows within the group. Default value is false.

setInResult.!description: Sets a new value for property inResult. Specifies that the dimension referred to by the column shall be included in the granularity of the data result. It allows a finer distinction between a visible/grouped/(included)inResult column. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

getGroupHeaderFormatter.!description: Gets current value of property groupHeaderFormatter. If the column is grouped, this formatter is used to format the value in the group header

getLeadingProperty.!description: Gets current value of property leadingProperty. Defines the primary model property which is used inside the Column. In case of the analytical extension this means the property which is grouped by for dimensions or the property which is summed for measures.

getSummed.!description: Gets current value of property summed. If defined a sum for this column is calculated Default value is false.

setGroupHeaderFormatter.!description: Sets a new value for property groupHeaderFormatter. If the column is grouped, this formatter is used to format the value in the group header When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getInResult.!description: Gets current value of property inResult. Specifies that the dimension referred to by the column shall be included in the granularity of the data result. It allows a finer distinction between a visible/grouped/(included)inResult column. Default value is false.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.table.AnalyticalColumn.

setShowIfGrouped.!description: Sets a new value for property showIfGrouped. Specifies whether the column is displayed within the table even if it is grouped or not. A grouped column has the same value for every rows within the group. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

RowOnly.!description: Rows can only be selected on the row (and the selector is hidden).

Row.!description: Rows can be selected on the complete row.

RowSelector.!description: Rows can only be selected on the row selector.

sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu.!description: The column menu provides all common actions that can be performed on a column.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu.

setSelectionInterval.!description:
Sets the selection of the TreeTable to the given range (including boundaries).
Beware: The previous selection will be lost/overriden. If this is not wanted, please use "addSelectionInterval" and
"removeSelectionIntervall".

getCollapseRecursive.!description: Gets current value of property collapseRecursive. Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed. This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel Default value is true.

setFixedRowCount.!description: Setter for property fixedRowCount. This property is not supportd for the TreeTable and will be ignored! Default value is 0

setSelectionMode.!description: Sets the selection mode. The current selection is lost.

collapseAll.!description: Collapses all nodes (and lower if collapseRecursive is activated)

setExpandFirstLevel.!description: Sets a new value for property expandFirstLevel. Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

expand.!description: expands the row for the given row index

isExpanded.!description: Returns whether the row is expanded or collapsed.

removeSelectionInterval.!description:
All rows/tree nodes inside the range (including boundaries) will be deselected.
Tree nodes are referenced with theit absolute row index inside the tree- 
Please be aware, that the absolute row index only applies to the the tree which is visualized by the TreeTable.
Invisible nodes (collapsed child nodes) will not be regarded.

collapse.!description: collapses the row for the given row index

getGroupHeaderProperty.!description: Gets current value of property groupHeaderProperty. The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled

clearSelection.!description: Clears the complete selection (all tree table rows/nodes will lose their selection)

fireToggleOpenState.!description:
Fires event toggleOpenState to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'rowIndex' of type intindex of the expanded/collapsed row
  • 'rowContext' of type objectbinding context of the selected row
  • 'expanded' of type booleanflag whether the node has been expanded or collapsed

getSelectedIndices.!description:
Returns an array containing the row indices of all selected tree nodes (ordered ascending).

Please be aware of the following:
Due to performance/network traffic reasons, the getSelectedIndices function returns only all indices
of actually selected rows/tree nodes. Unknown rows/nodes (as in "not yet loaded" to the client), will not be
returned.

selectAll.!description:
Selects all available nodes/rows.

Explanation of the SelectAll function and what to expect from its behavior:
All rows/tree nodes locally stored on the client are selected.
In addition all subsequent rows/tree nodes, which will be paged into view are also immediatly selected.
However, due to obvious performance/network traffic reasons, the SelectAll function will NOT retrieve any data from the backend.

setGroupHeaderProperty.!description: Sets a new value for property groupHeaderProperty. The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

detachToggleOpenState.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'toggleOpenState' event of this sap.ui.table.TreeTable. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

getRootLevel.!description: Gets current value of property rootLevel. The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services. This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations. This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding. Default value is 0.

getUseGroupMode.!description: Gets current value of property useGroupMode. If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers. This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table. This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries) Default value is false.

expandToLevel.!description: Expands all nodes starting from the root level to the given level 'iLevel'. Only supported with ODataModel v2, when running in OperationMode.Client or OperationMode.Auto. Fully supported for sap.ui.model.ClientTreeBinding, e.g. if you are using a sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel. Please also see sap.ui.model.odata.OperationMode.

isIndexSelected.!description: Checks if the row at the given index is selected.

getExpandFirstLevel.!description: Gets current value of property expandFirstLevel. Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level. Default value is false.

attachToggleOpenState.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'toggleOpenState' event of this sap.ui.table.TreeTable. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.TreeTable itself. fired when a node has been expanded or collapsed (only available in hierachical mode)
attachToggleOpenState.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.TreeTable

setSelectedIndex.!description:
Overriden from Table.js base class.
In a TreeTable you can only select indices, which correspond to the currently visualized tree.
Invisible tree nodes (e.g. collapsed child nodes) can not be selected via Index, because they do not
correspond to a TreeTable row.

addSelectionInterval.!description:
Marks a range of tree nodes as selected, starting with iFromIndex going to iToIndex.
The TreeNodes are referenced via their absolute row index.
Please be aware, that the absolute row index only applies to the the tree which is visualized by the TreeTable.
Invisible nodes (collapsed child nodes) will not be regarded.

Please also take notice of the fact, that "addSelectionInterval" does not change any other selection.
To override the current selection, please use "setSelctionInterval" or for a single entry use "setSelectedIndex".

getSelectedIndex.!description:
Retrieves the lead selection index. The lead selection index is, among other things, used to determine the
start/end of a selection range, when using Shift-Click to select multiple entries at once.

setUseGroupMode.!description: Sets a new value for property useGroupMode. If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers. This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table. This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled. Default value is 100.

sap.ui.table.Table.!description:
Provides a comprehensive set of features for displaying and dealing with vast amounts of data. The Table control supports desktop PCs and tablet devices. On tablets, special consideration should be given to the number of visible columns and rows due to the limited performance of some devices.

In order to keep the document DOM as lean as possible, the Table control reuses its DOM elements of the rows. When the user scrolls, only the row contexts are changed but the rendered controls remain the same. This allows the Table control to handle huge amounts of data. Nevertheless, restrictions apply regarding the number of displayed columns. Keep the number as low as possible to improve performance. Due to the nature of tables, the used control for column templates also has a big influence on the performance.

The Table control relies completely on data binding, and its supported feature set is tightly coupled to the data model and binding being used.

fireRowSelectionChange.!description:
Fires event rowSelectionChange to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'rowIndex' of type introw index which has been clicked so that the selection has been changed (either selected or deselected)
  • 'rowContext' of type objectbinding context of the row which has been clicked so that selection has been changed
  • 'rowIndices' of type int[]array of row indices which selection has been changed (either selected or deselected)

getEnableBusyIndicator.!description: Gets current value of property enableBusyIndicator. Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own. The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling. Default value is false.

setSelectedIndex.!description: Sets a new value for property selectedIndex. Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is -1.

setRowHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property rowHeight. Height of a row of the Table in pixel. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

addSelectionInterval.!description: Adds the given selection interval to the selection. In case of single selection the "indexTo" value will be used for as selected index.

detachColumnResize.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnResize' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

detachCellContextmenu.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'cellContextmenu' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.table.Table.

detachFilter.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'filter' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

attachColumnFreeze.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnFreeze' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.Table itself. fired when a column of the table should be freezed
attachColumnFreeze.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.Table

attachRowSelectionChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'rowSelectionChange' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.Table itself. fired when the row selection of the table has been changed (the event parameters can be used to determine selection changes - to find out the selected rows you should better use the table selection API)
attachRowSelectionChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.Table

removeExtension.!description: Removes a extension from the aggregation named extension.

setFixedRowCount.!description: Sets a new value for property fixedRowCount. Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

removeColumn.!description: Removes a column from the aggregation named columns.

getSelectionBehavior.!description: Gets current value of property selectionBehavior. Selection behavior of the Table. This property defines whether the row selector is displayed and whether the row, the row selector or both can be clicked to select a row. Default value is RowSelector.

attachCellClick.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'cellClick' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.Table itself. fired when the user clicks a cell of the table (experimental!).
attachCellClick.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.Table

getContextByIndex.!description:
Returns the context of a row by its index. Please note that for server-based models like OData,
the supplied index might not have been loaded yet. If the context is not available at the client,
the binding will trigger a backend request and request this single context. Although this API
looks synchronous it may not return a context but load it and fire a change event on the binding.

For server-based models you should consider to only make this API call when the index is within
the currently visible scroll area.

setVisibleRowCountMode.!description: Sets a new value for property visibleRowCountMode. This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is, that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change the visibleRowCount interactively. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Fixed.

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property width. Width of the Table. Default value is auto.

setEnableColumnFreeze.!description: Sets a new value for property enableColumnFreeze. Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

attachColumnVisibility.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnVisibility' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.Table itself. fired when the visibility of a table column is changed.
attachColumnVisibility.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.Table

getEnableColumnReordering.!description: Gets current value of property enableColumnReordering. Flag to enable or disable column reordering Default value is true.

getEditable.!description: Gets current value of property editable. Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color in certain themes!) Default value is true.

attachColumnMove.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnMove' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.Table itself. fired when a table column is moved.
attachColumnMove.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.Table

getNoDataText.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
Gets current value of property noDataText. This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.

detachColumnSelect.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnSelect' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

attachCustomFilter.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'customFilter' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.Table itself. This event is triggered when the custom filter item of the column menu is pressed. The column on which the event was triggered is passed as parameter.
attachCustomFilter.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.table.Table

setShowOverlay.!description: Sets a new value for property showOverlay. Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

detachColumnMove.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnMove' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

getToolbar.!description: Gets content of aggregation toolbar. Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

fireCellContextmenu.!description:
Fires event cellContextmenu to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'cellControl' of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe control of the cell.
  • 'cellDomRef' of type ObjectDOM reference of the clicked cell. Can be used to position the context menu.
  • 'rowIndex' of type intRow index of the selected cell.
  • 'columnIndex' of type intColumn index of the selected cell. This is the index of visible columns and might differ from the index maintained in the column aggregation.
  • 'columnId' of type stringColumn ID of the selected cell.
  • 'rowBindingContext' of type sap.ui.model.ContextRow binding context of the selected cell.

indexOfColumn.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.table.Column in the aggregation named columns. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

Fires event columnMove to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnmoved column.
  • 'newPos' of type intnew position of the column.

destroyTitle.!description: Destroys the title in the aggregation named title.

setFixedBottomRowCount.!description: Sets a new value for property fixedBottomRowCount. Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

isIndexSelected.!description: Returns whether the given index is selected.

setColumnHeaderHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property columnHeaderHeight. Height of the column header of the Table in pixel. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getFixedColumnCount.!description: Gets current value of property fixedColumnCount. Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work. Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there will be no scrollbar for fixed columns. Default value is 0.

filter.!description: filter the given column by the given value
filter.!type:
function filter() { [native code for Array.filter, arity=1] }
, oColumn: sap.ui.table.Column, sValue: String) -> sap.ui.table.Table

fireSort.!description:
Fires event sort to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnsorted column.
  • 'sortOrder' of type sap.ui.table.SortOrderSort Order
  • 'columnAdded' of type booleanIf column was added to sorter this is true. If new sort is started this is set to false

detachGroup.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'group' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

setShowNoData.!description: Sets a new value for property showNoData. Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty. If set to false the table will just show a grid of empty cells When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

detachCellClick.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'cellClick' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

getSelectionMode.!description: Gets current value of property selectionMode. Selection mode of the Table. This property controls whether single or multiple rows can be selected and how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance. Default value is Multi.

destroyFooter.!description: Destroys the footer in the aggregation named footer.

setNavigationMode.!description: Sets a new value for property navigationMode. Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library! When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Scrollbar.

This property defines whether the row selector is displayed and whether the row, the row selector or both can be clicked to select a row. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is RowSelector.

Fires event cellClick to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'cellControl' of type sap.ui.core.ControlThe control of the cell.
  • 'cellDomRef' of type ObjectDOM reference of the clicked cell. Can be used to position the context menu.
  • 'rowIndex' of type intRow index of the selected cell.
  • 'columnIndex' of type intColumn index of the selected cell. This is the index of visible columns and might differ from the index maintained in the column aggregation.
  • 'columnId' of type stringColumn ID of the selected cell.
  • 'rowBindingContext' of type sap.ui.model.ContextRow binding context of the selected cell.

getRowHeight.!description: Gets current value of property rowHeight. Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

getFixedRowCount.!description: Gets current value of property fixedRowCount. Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. Default value is 0.

getEnableCellFilter.!description: Gets current value of property enableCellFilter. Flag whether to enable or disable the context menu on cells to trigger a filtering with the cell value. Default value is false.

Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
Sets a new value for property noDataText. This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

detachColumnFreeze.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the 'columnFreeze' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

getAllowColumnReordering.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Gets current value of property allowColumnReordering. Flag to enable or disable column reordering Default value is true.

getEnableSelectAll.!description: Gets current value of property enableSelectAll. Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner. This button is only displayed if the row selector is visible and the selection mode is set to any kind of multi selection. Default value is true.

fireColumnVisibility.!description:
Fires event columnVisibility to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnaffected column.
  • 'visible' of type booleannew value of the visible property.

selectAll.!description:
Add all rows to the selection.
Please note that for server based models like OData the indices which are considered to be selected might not
be available at the client yet. Calling getContextByIndex might not return a result but trigger a roundtrip
to request this single entity.

indexOfRow.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.table.Row in the aggregation named rows. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

fireColumnFreeze.!description:
Fires event columnFreeze to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • 'column' of type sap.ui.table.Columnreference to the column to freeze

getColumnHeaderHeight.!description: Gets current value of property columnHeaderHeight. Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.

attachColumnResize.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the 'columnResize' event of this sap.ui.table.Table. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.table.Table itself. fired when a table column is resized.
